intro: Jatropha stuhlmannii subsp. somalensis, commonly known as the Somali physic nut, is a shrub native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Its ecological role includes soil stabilization and providing habitat for local wildlife.
